topics.title: Types
topics.prompt: List different types of lanterns you have seen.
topics.sample: I have seen paper lanterns, sky lanterns, and animal-shaped ones at festivals.

topics.title: Colors & Shapes
topics.prompt: Describe the colors and shapes that make a lantern beautiful.
topics.sample: I like colorful lanterns shaped like fish or rabbits because they look lively and cute.

topics.title: Make One
topics.prompt: Explain how to make a simple paper lantern.
topics.sample: You need paper, scissors, glue, and a candle light. Cut, fold, and decorate it carefully.

topics.title: Parade
topics.prompt: Describe a lantern parade you joined or would like to join.
topics.sample: I joined a lantern parade once. People walked with bright lights and cheerful music. It was beautiful!

topics.title: Riddles
topics.prompt: Share a lantern riddle or make one yourself.
topics.sample: Riddle: It has a face but no mouth, it shines at night. (Answer: The moon)

topics.title: Wish
topics.prompt: If you could hang a wish on a lantern, what would it be and why?
topics.sample: I would wish for my familyâ€™s health and happiness because they are the most important to me.

topics.title: Design
topics.prompt: Design a lantern for your school. What theme and materials will you use?
topics.sample: I would make a green lantern from recycled paper to show care for the environment.

topics.title: Safety
topics.prompt: How can we enjoy lanterns safely?
topics.sample: We should keep candles away from children and never release lanterns near trees.

topics.title: Culture
topics.prompt: What do lanterns symbolize in your culture?
topics.sample: Lanterns symbolize light, hope, and family reunion in our culture.

topics.title: Compare
topics.prompt: Compare sky lanterns and handheld lanterns.
topics.sample: Sky lanterns float and look magical, but handheld ones are safer and easier to control.
